MainHeading.P: Do chuaidh an Cathaoirleach i gceannas ar 3 a chlog.

Speaker.P: I wish to remind the House that the time for sending in nominations for the existing casual vacancy will expire this afternoon at 5 o'clock.

I desire also to mention that the Central Fund Bill will, I think, be available for Second Reading on Wednesday next — this day week. The House will understand that on that Bill Senators will have an opportunity, if they wish to exercise it, of discussing the various Estimates, and may raise any question they choose on the Estimates.

The House will recollect that in the case of the Constitution (Amendment No. 5) Bill it agreed, on the report of the Select Committee to whom that Bill was sent, to postpone the consideration of the measure until they received a reply from the Dáil to their message suggesting the appointment of a Joint Committee. The Dáil, as you know, declined to appoint members on a Joint Committee, and consequently, if the Bill is to proceed in this House, it will be necessary for some Senator to put down a notice of motion recommitting the measure. If it is desired to go on with the Bill, I suggest the proper thing to do is to put down a notice of motion recommitting the Bill to the Select Committee. The Select Committee did not deal with the matter as a Committee; they simply agreed that for the present they would postpone consideration of it.

MainHeading.Title: DUBLIN UNITED TRAMWAYS (LUCAN ELECTRIC RAILWAYS) BILL, 1927.

Speaker.P: I have received the following communication from the Chairman of the Joint Committee on the Dublin United Tramways (Lucan Electric Railways) Bill, 1927:—
The Joint Committee on the Dublin United Tramways (Lucan Electric Railways) Bill, 1927, report:—
(1) That for the convenience of the parties they have adjourned from to-day (Tuesday) till Wednesday, the 23rd March, at 11 o'clock.
(2) That Senator P.W. Kenny was not present at to-day's sitting of the Joint Committee.
Signed,
W.E. THRIFT
(Chairman).

MainHeading.Title: PRIVATE BUSINESS. - DUN LAOGHAIRE BLACKROCK DALKEY CORPORATION BILL, 1924.

Speaker.P: I beg to move:—

That in view of the fact that the Report of the Commission on Local Administration in Dublin City and County is still under consideration, the Second Reading of the Dun Laoghaire Blackrock Dalkey Corporation Bill, 1924, be further adjourned until Wednesday, the 18th day of May, 1927, or, if the Seanad be not sitting on that day, the next day thereafter on which the Seanad shall so sit.
Motion put and agreed to.

MainHeading.LHead: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - PILOTAGE ORDER CONFIRMATION BILL, 1927
MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - PILOTAGE ORDER CONFIRMATION BILL, 1927 (PROVISIONAL ORDER CONFIRMATION BILL)—SECOND STAGE.
MainHeading.P: “Question—“That the Bill be now read a Second Time”—put and agreed to.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - PROVISIONAL COLLECTION OF TAXES BILL, 1926—FIFTH STAGE.

Speaker.P: This Bill has been certified by the Ceann Comhairle of the Dáil as a Money Bill.
Question —“That the Bill be received for Final Consideration, and do now pass”— put and agreed to.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - TELEPHONE CAPITAL BILL, 1927—FIFTH STAGE.

Speaker.P: This Bill has been certified by the Ceann Comhairle of the Dáil as a Money Bill.
Question—“That the Bill be received for Final Consideration, and do now pass”— put and agreed to.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - DEFENCE FORCES (TEMPORARY PROVISIONS) BILL, 1927—FIFTH STAGE.
MainHeading.P: Question —“That the Bill be received for Final Consideration, and do now pass”— put and agreed to.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - CIRCUIT COURT APPEALS BILL, 1927—FIFTH STAGE.
MainHeading.P: Question—“That the Bill be received for Final Consideration and do now pass”—put and agreed to.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - WILD BIRDS PROTECTION (AMENDMENT) BILL, 1927—FIFTH STAGE.

Speaker.P: I beg to move: “That this Bill be received for Final Consideration, and do now pass.”
Question put and agreed to.

So far as I can see, the business this day week will consist of the Central Fund Bill, Second Stage. As I have indicated, it will be open to Senators to discuss any particular Estimate they desire to call attention to. We will also have under consideration the Report Stage of the Industrial and Commercial Property (Protection) Bill, 1927, and the Constitution (Amendment No. 5) Bill, 1926, provided the notice of motion I have mentioned is put down. There will be also the election of a Senator to fill the casual vacancy. Apart from that, I do not contemplate we will have any other business ready. The House will meet this day week, because the election has been fixed for that day.
The Seanad adjourned at 3.10 p.m. till Wednesday, 23rd March.
